FuncDef:
The ppp authentication-mode command configures a PPP authentication mode.
The undo ppp authentication-mode command deletes the configured PPP authentication mode.
By default, no authentication mode is configured.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Generally, PPP involves five phases: link dead phase, link establishment phase, authentication phase, network-layer protocol phase, and link termination phase.
In most cases, the devices on both ends of a PPP link must complete the authentication phase before entering the network-layer protocol phase.
PPP authentication is mainly used for:
Hosts and Devices that connect to a PPP network server through switched circuits or dial-up linesDedicated lines
There are two major PPP authentication modes: PAP and CHAP. To configure an authentication mode, run the ppp authentication-mode command.

Prerequisites
Interfaces are connected, and physical parameters of the interfaces are configured so that the physical layer status of the interfaces is Up.
PPP has been configured as the link layer protocol of the interface.
Configuration Impact
If the ppp authentication-mode command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one. After the configuration, the local Device authenticates the remote Device as configured.
Precautions
After the configuration, you must run the shutdown, commit, and undo shutdown commands in the corresponding interface view for the configuration to take effect.
PAP is not a secure protocol, and it is recommended to use CHAP.
